name: Unbreakable Kimmy Schmidt Quiz | Television | 10 Questions

questions.text: While the series is set in New York City, Kimmy is rescued from a bunker in what city during the opening of the first episode?
questions.explanation:
Durnsville, Indiana.

	The premise of the show is that Kimmy and other three were tricked into hiding in a bomb shelter during the "apocalypse" when the calendars turned from 1999 to 2000. They were trapped down in the bunker with only the four of them and a creepy old priest. The three other city options were from "Murder, She Wrote", "Buffy the Vampire Slayer" and "Family Guy".

questions.text: Matt Lauer, host of the "Today Show", called Kimmy and her three companions "Cave Dwellers" on the show the morning after they were rescued.
questions.explanation:
False.

	He actually referred to them as "Mole Women" when they appeared on the show for an interview. Kimmy and the other captives made national headlines. After a few days the other girls went back to life as it was, while Kimmy moved to New York to experience the world.

questions.text: What was the reasoning for why the girls were convinced to hide in the bunker?
questions.explanation:
Nuclear apocalypse.

	The priest who convinced them into hiding told of pending doom. He preached about the world ending and told the girls that a nuclear apocalypse made it impossible to live in the outside world.

questions.text: How long were the girls trapped in the bunker?
questions.explanation:
15 years.

	The girls were in the bunker from 1999 until 2014.  The Kimmy was just 14 when the priest, played by Jon Hamm, convinced her to hide out in the bunker.

questions.text: When she prepared to head into the bunker, Kimmy packed a book from what series to take with her?
questions.explanation:
The Babysitters Club.

	Kimmy brought a copy of one of "The Babysitters Club" books. The girls read it over and over, and even acted out parts of it to help them pass the time.

questions.text: Kimmy got a job as a nanny after moving to New York. One of the children who she had to watch had a special themed birthday party. What was the theme?
questions.explanation:
Superheroes.

	Kimmy's roommate, Titus Andromedon, and several of his acting friends came to the party dressed as knock-off heroes and saved the day, ensuring that Kimmy got to keep her job.

questions.text: Kimmy's roommate Titus makes his living as a street performer. What character does he dress up as to earn money?
questions.explanation:
Iron Man.

	Titus, and several of the other performers on his block, couldn't afford the licensed costumes. Instead they were poorly made knock-off costumes.

questions.text: Kimmy had a large sum of money in a purple backpack that she carried around with her. What was the name brand of the backpack?
questions.explanation:
Jansport.

	Kimmy took $13,000 in cash with her into a club and sat the bag down unattended.  She spent a decent part of an episode asking people if they'd seen her purple Jansport.

questions.text: What is the name of Kimmy's stepfather who shows up during the ninth episode?
questions.explanation:
Randy.

	Randy was the lead detective searching for Kimmy. When he couldn't find her, he became close with Kimmy's mom and ended up marrying her.  Randy and Kimmy's mom had a daughter together and named her Keemy.

questions.text: Other than his "day job" as a costumed street performer, what was the biggest credit on Titus' acting resume?
options: The lead role in a junior high school play
As a backup dancer on a short-lived Broadway play
A dead body in a regional TV commercial
questions.explanation:
Winning on a "Bum Fight" DVD.

	Titus wasn't proud of his "acting" credit, but told Kimmy that he had totally beaten up the homeless bum he was pitted against. The first season of the show ran 13-episodes and was produced by Tina Fey. Ellie Kemper played the titular character of Kimmy.
